candidates.definition: areas designated or used for specific human activities or purposes

positive_examples: The kitchen area was equipped with modern appliances for meal preparation.
Children ran around the playground while parents watched from the sitting area.
She stepped outside onto the patio to enjoy her morning coffee.
The dining room had enough space for eight people around the large table.
He felt uncomfortable when strangers invaded his personal space on the crowded train.
The indoor lounge provided a comfortable waiting area for travelers.
negative_examples: The mountain range stretched across the entire horizon.
GPS coordinates pinpointed their exact location in the wilderness.
The administrative district encompassed three counties.
Water flowed down from the elevated terrain into the valley below.
The geographic boundary separated the two neighboring countries.
Scientists measured the atmospheric pressure at different altitudes.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: GeographicRegion, Territory, Boundary, Location

candidates.definition: Mathematical or geometric properties that define position, shape, or dimension in space

positive_examples: The GPS coordinates showed our exact location at 40.7589° N, 73.9851° W.
Draw a straight line connecting these two points on the map.
The airplane's flight path created a perfect arc across the sky.
We measured the perimeter of the rectangular garden plot.
The intersection of Broadway and 42nd Street forms a geometric angle.
Scientists plotted the satellite's orbital plane around Earth.
negative_examples: The neighborhood has a strong sense of community.
Sales increased in the northeastern region this quarter.
The storm system covered a large area of the midwest.
We reserved a table in the restaurant's outdoor section.
The wildlife preserve spans thousands of acres.
Our company operates in the European market.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: GeographicArea, Territory, Zone, District, Sector

candidates.definition: A designated area with built facilities serving specific organizational or functional purposes

positive_examples: The university campus spans 200 acres with dormitories, classrooms, and research facilities
Fort Bragg serves as a major military installation for training operations
The commercial property includes warehouses and office buildings for logistics companies
Terminal 3 has a staging area where ground crews prepare equipment before flights arrive
The industrial facility houses manufacturing equipment and administrative offices
This residential development features homes, parks, and community centers
negative_examples: The Amazon rainforest covers millions of square miles
Death Valley is known for its extreme temperatures and desert landscape
The Pacific Ocean stretches across vast distances between continents
Downtown Chicago has heavy traffic during rush hour
The hiking trail winds through mountainous terrain for several miles
Antarctica remains largely unexplored due to harsh weather conditions
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: GeographicRegion, NaturalArea, AdministrativeTerritory, ClimateZone
